intro: Woodia trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed woodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and resemble the shape of its common name. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Woodia trilobata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
